com.firebase.jobdispatcher

Class RetryStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.firebase.jobdispatcher.RetryStrategy

  • public final class RetryStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
    RetryStrategy represents an approach to handling job execution failures. Jobs will have a time-based backoff enforced, based on the chosen policy (one of RETRY_POLICY_EXPONENTIAL or RETRY_POLICY_LINEAR.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RetryStrategy.RetryPolicy
      Defines the list of acceptable retry policies.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RetryStrategy DEFAULT_EXPONENTIAL
      Expected schedule is: [30s, 60s, 120s, 240s, ..., 3600s]
      static RetryStrategy DEFAULT_LINEAR
      Expected schedule is: [30s, 60s, 90s, 120s, ..., 3600s]
      static int RETRY_POLICY_EXPONENTIAL
      Increase the backoff time exponentially.
      static int RETRY_POLICY_LINEAR
      Increase the backoff time linearly.

    • Field Detail

      • RETRY_POLICY_EXPONENTIAL

        public static final int RETRY_POLICY_EXPONENTIAL
        Increase the backoff time exponentially.

        Calculated using initial_backoff * 2 ^ (num_failures - 1).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RETRY_POLICY_LINEAR

        public static final int RETRY_POLICY_LINEAR
        Increase the backoff time linearly.

        Calculated using initial_backoff * num_failures.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_EXPONENTIAL

        public static final RetryStrategy DEFAULT_EXPONENTIAL
        Expected schedule is: [30s, 60s, 120s, 240s, ..., 3600s]

      • DEFAULT_LINEAR

        public static final RetryStrategy DEFAULT_LINEAR
        Expected schedule is: [30s, 60s, 90s, 120s, ..., 3600s]

    • Method Detail

      • getPolicy

        public int getPolicy()
        Returns the backoff policy in place.

      • getInitialBackoff

        public int getInitialBackoff()
        Returns the initial backoff (i.e. when # of failures == 1), in seconds.

      • getMaximumBackoff

        public int getMaximumBackoff()
        Returns the maximum backoff duration in seconds.
